Welcome!
The WordPress CoreCore Core is the set of software required to run WordPress. The Core Development Team builds WordPress. Performance Team is dedicated to monitoring, enhancing, and promoting performance in WordPress core and its surrounding ecosystem. We build and manage the Performance Lab plugin, a collection of performance-related “feature projects” for WordPress core.
Found a bug or have an idea for a new Performance Lab module? Create an issue in our Performance Lab repo.
Want to contribute? Get started quickly with our issues marked as good first issues for new contributors or see all of our issues that need developer help.
What are our priorities for this year? Check out our roadmap to learn more.
Other questions? Check out our Handbook.


Communication and Meetings
You can always find us in the #core-performance channel in Slack. Feel free to pop in and share your thoughts and ideas!
Our next weekly chat is Tuesday 15:00 UTC in #core-performance and we also hold a monthly bug scrub on the first Wednesday of the month at 15:00 UTC in #core-performance. Our next monthly bug scrub is Wednesday, November 2, 2022 at 15:00 UTC.











 
Bethany Chobanian Lang

6:08 pm on July 26, 2022 



					 
				

Welcome to the Core Performance Team blog!


👋 Welcome to the CoreCore Core is the set of software required to run WordPress. The Core Development Team builds WordPress. Performance Team blog!
Because our work is so integrated with WordPress core, plugins, and themes, our blog posts are typically shared on those blogs instead of being posted here.
You can view all performance-related blog posts – including core feature and merge proposals, weekly chat agenda and meeting notes, and other discussions – by checking out our tags on those other blogs:
https://make.wordpress.org/core/tag/performance/https://make.wordpress.org/plugins/tag/performance/https://make.wordpress.org/themes/tags/performance/Login to Reply

Felix Arntz

9:26 pm on February 28, 2023 



					 
				

Announcing a new Core Performance Team Rep


Thanks to everyone for their nominations for the new Core Performance Team Rep! Because the nominations were unanimous, no further voting was necessary. As announced in our chat earlier today, I am happy to share that @clarkeemily will be the new CoreCore Core is the set of software required to run WordPress. The Core Development Team builds WordPress. Performance Team RepTeam Rep A Team Rep is a person who represents the Make WordPress team to the rest of the project, make sure issues are raised and addressed as needed, and coordinates cross-team efforts.. As a reminder, every Make WordPress team typically has two Team Reps, so Emily and myself will be the Team Reps going forward.
At this point, I would also like to express my gratitude for all the valuable contributions by @mxbclang to the Core Performance Team, in which we collaborated together well more than the 6 months since the official Team Rep roles were formally established. The privilege of having worked with you is mutual, thank you for helping to shape this team for where we are today.
Going forward, Emily and I will work together to continue ensuring that the Performance Team is well-represented to the broader project and in regular updates to WordPress leadership and community. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to us here or in SlackSlack Slack is a Collaborative Group Chat Platform https://slack.com/. The WordPress community has its own Slack Channel at https://make.wordpress.org/chat/..Login to Reply

Bethany Chobanian Lang

5:23 pm on February 1, 2023 



					 
				

Core Performance Team Rep Updates


As mentioned in a few recent CoreCore Core is the set of software required to run WordPress. The Core Development Team builds WordPress. Performance SlackSlack Slack is a Collaborative Group Chat Platform https://slack.com/. The WordPress community has its own Slack Channel at https://make.wordpress.org/chat/. meetings, unfortunately I’ve been unavailable to run team meetings and participate in the Core Performance Team’s work due to other project commitments. Unfortunately, these commitments are going to continue, and therefore at this time I am resigning from the Performance Team RepTeam Rep A Team Rep is a person who represents the Make WordPress team to the rest of the project, make sure issues are raised and addressed as needed, and coordinates cross-team efforts. position.
It’s truly been a privilege getting to work with this team for the last year, and to see our work continue to expand and deepen to address the crucial issue of performance in WordPress. I look forward to continuing to watch the team’s work and seeing all of the great things to come!
Given my resignation, we are now opening a vote for a second Performance Team Rep to support @flixos90. As a reminder, full details on the Team Rep role are available here. The main functions of the Team Reps are to:
Serve as representatives of the Team to the rest of the WordPress project
Ensure that issues raised within the Team that could affect other teams as well as the broader WordPress project are communicated as needed
Assist with coordinating any necessary cross-team efforts
(Ideally) Post a weekly update on the Team’s work to https://make.wordpress.org/updates/
Share a quarterly update on the Team’s work (including priorities, challenges, and big wins) with WordPress project leadership
Historically, Team Reps have served for a year, though that is not a hard and fast rule. We’ll follow the election process outlined here.
In the comments of this post, share your nomination(s). Self-nominations are welcome.
Nominations will close on Friday, February 24, 2023
Once the deadline has passed for nominating, a comment will be added and pinned to the top of this nominations post
After nominations have ended, a poll for voting will be opened and linked from a voting announcement post that will be shared on https://make.wordpress.org/performance/ by Monday, February 27, 2023
Voting will stay open for two weeks and will end on Friday, March 10, 2023
Once the deadline has passed for voting, a comment will be added and pinned to the top of the voting announcement post
Once the results have been finalized and announced in the Tuesday, March 14, 2023 chat, a new post announcing the selected Team Reps will be added on https://make.wordpress.org/performance/
A comment will be added and pinned to the top of the voting announcement post
I’d like to nominate Emily Clarke (@clarkeemily), who has been doing a fantastic job on all of the things that I previously worked on while I’ve been occupied with other commitments.
Please share your nomination(s) for Core Performance Team Reps in the comments of this post by Friday, February 24, 2023.Login to Reply
